capabilities.name: agent-creator
capabilities.description: Agent Architect — translates user requirements into precisely-tuned agent specifications. Designs expert persona, comprehensive system prompts, optimal configuration (model, color, tools), and triggering examples. Generates complete agent .md files for Claude Code plugins.

capabilities.name: code-architect
capabilities.description: Senior Software Architect Agent — analyzes existing codebase patterns and conventions, then delivers comprehensive implementation blueprints with specific files to create/modify, component designs, data flows, and build sequences. Makes decisive architectural choices with rationale.

capabilities.name: code-explorer
capabilities.description: Expert Code Analyst Agent — traces execution paths, maps architecture layers, understands patterns and abstractions, and documents dependencies to inform new development. Provides complete understanding of feature implementations from entry points to data storage through all layers.

capabilities.name: code-reviewer
capabilities.description: Expert Code Reviewer Agent — reviews code for bugs, logic errors, security vulnerabilities, and code quality issues using confidence-based filtering (only reports issues with confidence >= 80). Checks adherence to project conventions in CLAUDE.md. Groups findings by severity.

capabilities.name: doc-mgr
capabilities.description: Documentation Specialist Agent — plans, creates, validates, and maintains project documentation throughout the development lifecycle. Handles documentation audits, post-implementation docs, and knowledge alignment.

capabilities.name: ecosystem-steward
capabilities.description: Ecosystem Steward Agent — responsible for cross-project alignment across the ADF ecosystem. Runs 6 alignment checks (governing docs, interface contracts, dependency chain, terminology, intent, decisions), produces structured reports with severity-rated findings, and proposes backlog items routed to the correct project. Supports full audit, targeted check, drift scan, and follow-up modes.

capabilities.name: improver
capabilities.description: Cross-cutting Improvement Team agent — identifies improvement opportunities from patterns across completed work, KB, memory, and operational data. Produces improvement proposals as backlog items. Part of the Improvement Team defined in the Agentic Work System Architecture. Does NOT execute improvements — it proposes them. Does NOT assess current quality (that's the reviewer) or verify completion (that's the validator). Focuses on "how do we get better?"

capabilities.name: kb-manager
capabilities.description: KB Intelligence Agent — provides digest, curation, synthesis, recommendation, and content pipeline assessment services over the Knowledge Base. Consumes 16 KB MCP tools as a client. Supports 5 modes: DIGEST (activity dashboard), CURATE (health audit), SYNTHESIZE (combine related entries), RECOMMEND (project-relevant entries), and CONTENT (publication readiness assessment).

capabilities.name: orchestrator
capabilities.description: Execute-Plan Orchestrator — phase-level execution coordinator that parses plan.md and tasks.md, spawns 3-5 parallel task-executor agents per phase, monitors progress via TaskList, invokes ralph-loop at phase boundaries, and validates exit criteria via phase-validator. Manages fix tasks, run logs, checkpoints, and session logs.

capabilities.name: phase-validator
capabilities.description: Execute-Plan Phase Validator — exit criteria checker that parses criteria from plan.md, categorizes by type (test-based, execution-based, artifact-based, manual review), runs validation checks, and generates structured pass/fail reports for the orchestrator.

capabilities.name: planner
capabilities.description: Planning Agent — implements the ADF-PLANNING-SPEC methodology. Decomposes intent into executable work organized for parallel execution by agents with verified capabilities. Runs the seven-step planning process: understand intent, decompose into work units, organize phases, parallelization strategy, capability assessment (hard gate), testing strategy, risk/contingency. Produces plan.md and tasks.md drafts. Subordinate to Work Manager in the Work Management hierarchy.

capabilities.name: plugin-validator
capabilities.description: Plugin Validation Specialist Agent — comprehensive validation of Claude Code plugin structure, plugin.json manifest, component files (commands, agents, skills, hooks), naming conventions, MCP configuration, file organization, and security. Produces structured validation reports with severity-rated findings.

capabilities.name: project-init
capabilities.description: ADF Project Initialization Agent — bootstraps ADF project structure from an existing concept brief. Creates folders, moves files, configures git, drafts initial intent.md from brief content, and validates structure. Infrastructure setup and initial intent extraction only — does not do full Discover stage work.

capabilities.name: reviewer
capabilities.description: Cross-cutting Review Team agent — quality assessment for any artifact across any project or domain. Evaluates plans, designs, code, briefs, and other artifacts against quality standards. Provides structured feedback with severity-rated findings (Critical/High/Low). Part of the Review Team defined in the Agentic Work System Architecture. Dispatched by orchestrators, Work Manager, or humans with artifact + review criteria as input. Does NOT verify completion (that's the validator). Focuses on "is this good?" not "is this done?"

capabilities.name: skill-reviewer
capabilities.description: Skill Quality Reviewer Agent — reviews and improves Claude Code skills for structure quality, description triggering effectiveness, progressive disclosure implementation, content organization, and adherence to best practices. Provides severity-rated findings with specific fix recommendations.

capabilities.name: task-executor
capabilities.description: Execute-Plan Task Executor — task-level worker agent that receives 1-4 assigned tasks from the orchestrator, implements changes, validates acceptance criteria, and commits atomically. Supports TDD workflow (write tests first, red-green cycle) from Phase 5 onward.

capabilities.name: validator
capabilities.description: Cross-cutting Validation Team agent — completion verification and drift detection for any work across any project or domain. Checks current state against target state (acceptance criteria, checklists, exit criteria). Produces structured pass/fail reports. Part of the Validation Team defined in the Agentic Work System Architecture. Does NOT assess quality (that's the reviewer). Focuses on "is this done?" not "is this good?"

capabilities.name: adf-env
capabilities.description: ADF Environment Manager — manages Claude Code environment across user and project layers, validates session discipline, runs health checks

capabilities.name: adf-review
capabilities.description: ADF Review Plugin — provides slash commands for artifact reviews (/adf-review:artifact, /adf-review:artifact-internal, /adf-review:artifact-external). Wraps the adf-review skill with convenient command interface.

capabilities.name: agent-sdk-dev
capabilities.description: Claude Agent SDK development kit — scaffolding, verifier agents for Python and TypeScript SDK projects

capabilities.name: claude-code-setup
capabilities.description: Analyze codebases and recommend Claude Code automations — hooks, skills, MCP servers, plugins

capabilities.name: claude-md-management
capabilities.description: Audit, improve, and maintain CLAUDE.md files across repositories

capabilities.name: code-review
capabilities.description: Automated code review — analyzes code for quality, patterns, and issues with specialized review agents

capabilities.name: commit-commands
capabilities.description: Git workflow automation — commit, push, open PRs, and clean up gone branches

capabilities.name: context7
capabilities.description: Retrieve up-to-date documentation and code examples for any programming library via Context7

capabilities.name: ecosystem-alignment
capabilities.description: Ecosystem Steward — monitors cross-project alignment across the ADF ecosystem, detects drift between interrelated systems (ADF, Work OS, Krypton, KB, Memory Layer), and recommends corrective actions. Provides /ecosystem:audit command and ecosystem-steward agent for full audits, targeted checks, drift scans, and follow-up tracking.

capabilities.name: feature-dev
capabilities.description: Guided feature development workflow — clarifying questions, codebase analysis, architecture review before implementation

capabilities.name: github
capabilities.description: GitHub MCP server integration — issues, PRs, repos, code search via GitHub API

capabilities.name: hookify
capabilities.description: Custom hook creation helper — scaffolds PreToolUse, PostToolUse, and other event-driven hooks

capabilities.name: kb-manager
capabilities.description: Knowledge Base Intelligence Layer — digest, curate, synthesize, recommend, and manage content pipeline from KB data. Provides slash commands (/kb:digest, /kb:curate, /kb:recommend, /kb:capture) and a kb-manager agent.

capabilities.name: link-triage
capabilities.description: Link Triage Pipeline — operate the link triage pipeline with run, backfill, status check, and collection listing. Project-scoped plugin for the link-triage-pipeline repo.

capabilities.name: playwright
capabilities.description: Browser automation via Playwright — navigate, click, fill forms, take screenshots, run code snippets

capabilities.name: plugin-dev
capabilities.description: End-to-end plugin development — create plugins, skills, agents, hooks, commands, and MCP integrations

capabilities.name: pyright-lsp
capabilities.description: Python Language Server Protocol via Pyright — auto-diagnostics, type checking, go-to-definition, find references

capabilities.name: ralph-loop
capabilities.description: Iterative development loop — structured review cycles for refining code and artifacts

capabilities.name: security-guidance
capabilities.description: PreToolUse security hook — detects command injection, XSS, eval, pickle deserialization, and other dangerous patterns

capabilities.name: stripe
capabilities.description: Stripe payments integration via bundled MCP server — payment processing, subscriptions, billing

capabilities.name: supabase
capabilities.description: Supabase integration via bundled MCP server — database queries, auth, storage, edge functions

capabilities.name: typescript-lsp
capabilities.description: TypeScript Language Server Protocol — auto-diagnostics after edits, go-to-definition, find references, type info

capabilities.name: vercel
capabilities.description: Vercel deployment integration via MCP server — deployments, projects, environment variables, logs

capabilities.name: adf-review
capabilities.description: ADF Review Skill — orchestrates two-phase artifact reviews (internal Ralph Loop + external multi-model). Unified entry point for all ADF review processes.

capabilities.name: adf-workflow
capabilities.description: ADF Workflow Skill — companion skill that teaches agents when and how to use ADF MCP server tools. Provides narrative workflow instructions for stage transitions, reviews, and artifact management.

capabilities.name: adr
capabilities.description: ADR Skill — manages Architecture Decision Records as ADF decision-type artifacts. Supports create (auto-numbering, template), list (status table), update-status (with archive moves), and link (connect to design.md Decision Log) workflows.

capabilities.name: algorithmic-art
capabilities.description: Creating algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive

capabilities.name: brand-guidelines
capabilities.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort

capabilities.name: canvas-design
capabilities.description: Create beautiful visual art in .png and .pdf documents using design philosophy.

capabilities.name: doc-coauthoring
capabilities.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation.

capabilities.name: docx
capabilities.description: 'Comprehensive document creation, editing, and analysis with support

capabilities.name: external-review
capabilities.description: External Review MCP Server — sends artifacts to external LLM models (GPT, Gemini, Kimi) for independent review. Provides list_models and review tools with parallel execution and cost tracking.

capabilities.name: frontend-design
capabilities.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design

capabilities.name: internal-comms
capabilities.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications,

capabilities.name: mcp-builder
capabilities.description: Guide for creating high-quality MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers

capabilities.name: pdf
capabilities.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables,

capabilities.name: pptx
capabilities.description: 'Presentation creation, editing, and analysis. When Claude needs to work

capabilities.name: project-health
capabilities.description: Project Health Auditor — code-level health auditing with 19 checks across 6 categories (test health, dependency health, code hygiene, secrets & config, build-to-design drift, documentation sync). Complements adf-env (governance layer) and adf-review (artifact quality). Supports Python, TypeScript, Go, Rust with auto-detection and stage-aware check selection.

capabilities.name: security-review
capabilities.description: Security Review — code-level and design-level security analysis with 22 checks across 5 categories (injection & input validation, cryptography, unsafe operations, supply chain, design security posture). Complements project-health (secrets, CVEs) and security-guidance (runtime prevention). Supports Python, TypeScript, Go, Rust with auto-detection, stage-aware check selection, and OWASP pattern matching.

capabilities.name: skill-creator
capabilities.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users

capabilities.name: slack-gif-creator
capabilities.description: Knowledge and utilities for creating animated GIFs optimized for Slack.

capabilities.name: theme-factory
capabilities.description: Toolkit for styling artifacts with a theme. These artifacts can be slides,

capabilities.name: web-artifacts-builder
capabilities.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML

capabilities.name: webapp-testing
capabilities.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using

capabilities.name: xlsx
capabilities.description: 'Comprehensive spreadsheet creation, editing, and analysis with support

capabilities.name: adf-server
capabilities.description: ADF MCP Server — read-only interface to ADF specs, prompts, stubs, knowledge base, and capabilities registry. Provides tools for stage workflow, review prompts, artifact specs, project validation.

capabilities.name: github-mcp
capabilities.description: GitHub MCP server — repo management, issues, PRs, code search

capabilities.name: knowledge-base
capabilities.description: Knowledge Base MCP Server — semantic search, capture, query, and management of a personal knowledge base. Provides 16 tools for search, retrieval, backlog management, focus topics, and content lifecycle.

capabilities.name: memory-layer
capabilities.description: Memory Layer MCP Server — persistent contextual memory service with namespace-scoped write/search/update/archive flows, review candidates, stats, reconciliation, and failed-memory lifecycle tools.

capabilities.name: stitch-mcp
capabilities.description: Google Stitch MCP Server — official remote MCP server for AI-powered UI/UX design generation. Provides 6 tools: create projects, generate screens from text prompts, list/get projects and screens. Outputs HTML/Tailwind CSS designs convertible to React, Vue, Flutter, etc. Hosted by Google at stitch.googleapis.com/mcp. Auth via API key or OAuth.

capabilities.name: stripe-mcp
capabilities.description: Stripe MCP server — payments, subscriptions, billing management

capabilities.name: supabase-mcp
capabilities.description: Supabase MCP server — database management, auth, storage, edge functions

capabilities.name: vercel-mcp
capabilities.description: Vercel MCP server — deployment management, project configuration, domains

capabilities.name: work-management-mcp
capabilities.description: MCP server for Work Management system, providing project and task tools.
